Option.Name: Special category used for a chance to not grant an item
Weapons (also used as a default value)
Goods (consumables, key items, upgrade materials, etc)

lotItemBasePoint01.Wiki: The relative chance (weight) of item 1 for droprate calculation

lotItemBasePoint02.Wiki: The relative chance (weight) of item 2 for droprate calculation

lotItemBasePoint03.Wiki: The relative chance (weight) of item 3 for droprate calculation

lotItemBasePoint04.Wiki: The relative chance (weight) of item 4 for droprate calculation

lotItemBasePoint05.Wiki: The relative chance (weight) of item 5 for droprate calculation

lotItemBasePoint06.Wiki: The relative chance (weight) of item 6 for droprate calculation

lotItemBasePoint07.Wiki: The relative chance (weight) of item 7 for droprate calculation

lotItemBasePoint08.Wiki: The relative chance (weight) of item 8 for droprate calculation

cumulateLotPoint01.Wiki: Value added onto lotItemBasePoint whenever the item lot has been rolled. Uses cumulateNumFlagId

cumulateLotPoint02.Wiki: Value added onto lotItemBasePoint whenever the item lot has been rolled. Uses cumulateNumFlagId

cumulateLotPoint03.Wiki: Value added onto lotItemBasePoint whenever the item lot has been rolled. Uses cumulateNumFlagId

cumulateLotPoint04.Wiki: Value added onto lotItemBasePoint whenever the item lot has been rolled. Uses cumulateNumFlagId

cumulateLotPoint05.Wiki: Value added onto lotItemBasePoint whenever the item lot has been rolled. Uses cumulateNumFlagId

cumulateLotPoint06.Wiki: Value added onto lotItemBasePoint whenever the item lot has been rolled. Uses cumulateNumFlagId

cumulateLotPoint07.Wiki: Value added onto lotItemBasePoint whenever the item lot has been rolled. Uses cumulateNumFlagId

cumulateLotPoint08.Wiki: Value added onto lotItemBasePoint whenever the item lot has been rolled. Uses cumulateNumFlagId

getItemFlagId01.Wiki: Event flags for individual items; how these behave exactly is not currently known

getItemFlagId02.Wiki: Event flags for individual items; how these behave exactly is not currently known

getItemFlagId03.Wiki: Event flags for individual items; how these behave exactly is not currently known

getItemFlagId04.Wiki: Event flags for individual items; how these behave exactly is not currently known

getItemFlagId05.Wiki: Event flags for individual items; how these behave exactly is not currently known

getItemFlagId06.Wiki: Event flags for individual items; how these behave exactly is not currently known

getItemFlagId07.Wiki: Event flags for individual items; how these behave exactly is not currently known

getItemFlagId08.Wiki: Event flags for individual items; how these behave exactly is not currently known

getItemFlagId.Wiki: Event flag set once an item has been granted. The flag is not set if the lot is random and chooses no item.\nIf this flag is set, the itemLot will be skipped

cumulateNumFlagId.Wiki: The initial event flag ID for an 8-bit event value1 that store the number of times this item lot has been rolled.\nUsed with other cumulate fields

cumulateNumMax.Wiki: Maximum amount of itemLot roll attempts before guaranteeing the item drop.\nExample: a value of 3 would do nothing until AFTER 3 unsuccessful attempts, and would guarantee item drop at attempt #4.\nUses cumulateLotPoint

lotItem_Rarity.Wiki: Determines how fancy the glowing treasure effect is; does not affect droprate

lotItemNum01.Wiki: The quantity of the item to give.\nSetting this above 1 for items like weapons and armor will grant a single stacked item rather than two separate ones,\nwhich is usually not desirable

lotItemNum02.Wiki: The quantity of the item to give.\nSetting this above 1 for items like weapons and armor will grant a single stacked item rather than two separate ones,\nwhich is usually not desirable

lotItemNum05.Wiki: The quantity of the item to give.\nSetting this above 1 for items like weapons and armor will grant a single stacked item rather than two separate ones,\nwhich is usually not desirable

lotItemNum06.Wiki: The quantity of the item to give.\nSetting this above 1 for items like weapons and armor will grant a single stacked item rather than two separate ones,\nwhich is usually not desirable

enableLuck01.Wiki: Allows item discovery buffs to affect this item's droprate

cumulateReset01.Wiki: Whether getting each item will reset the cumulate counter
